subsc: General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector,Crops,Other domestic and international trade,General industry and trade sector,Central government administration
trustfund:
TF020843-MALAWI DEBT SERVICE,TF033111-MALAWI - TRADE AND DISTRIBUTION ADJUSTMENT,TF022829-FISCAL RESTRUCTURING &
            DEREGULATION PROGRAM,TF020968-FISCAL RESTRUCTURING &

abstracts.cdata!:
To assist Malawi to attain its economic
            objectives and succeed in alleviating the country's
            pervasive poverty problem, the Fiscal Restructuring and
            Deregulation Program Project will aim to: 1) prioritize,
            protect and, where necessary, expand inter-sectoral and
            intra-sectoral allocations to the social sectors on a
            sustainable basis while staying within the overall fiscal
            framework now being monitored under the IMF's Enhanced
            Structural Adjustment Facility (ESAF) program; and 2)
            accelerate the consolidation of structural measures already
            initiated by the government of Malawi under previous
            adjustment operations. This will include complete removal of
            remaining pricing and marketing constraints on smallholder
            agriculture, and removal of the biding constraints to
            broad-based private sector entry and development. The
            project will have the following components: 1) fiscal
            restructuring which involves public spending reorientation,
            restoring of fiscal discipline, civil service reform, and
            tax and tariff reforms; 2) deregulation of agricultural
            policies including access to land, access to cash crops,
            access to inputs, access to markets, and access to economic
            transport; and 3) deregulation of private sector development
            policies comprising investment promotion, deconcentration
            and privatization.
